Constructor Detail

RoundHand

public RoundHand(Player[] players,
                 int handnumber,
                 int redeal,
                 int windoftheround,
                 int roundhand,
                 int deadwallsize)
sets up a round hand object, by binding all the relevant information for it

Parameters:
players - the filled Player[] array
handnumber - the hand number for this roundhand
redeal - which redeal this is
windoftheround - the wind of the round for this hand
roundhand - the number that makes sure players have the right wind
deadwallsize - the number of tiles in the dead wall
Method Detail

playRoundHand

public int playRoundHand()
                  throws IllegalOutException
plays a hand, and returns the winner, or in case of a draw, RoundHand.DRAW (== -1)

Returns:
the position of the winning player in the players array, or in case of a draw, RoundHand.DRAW (== -1)
Throws:
IllegalOutException

logStart

private void logStart()
Logs the start of the hand

resetPlayers

private void resetPlayers()
instructs all players to reset their per-hand values, and prepare for a new hand

determinePlay

private void determinePlay()
                    throws PlayerWonException
instructs all players to evaluate their best approach to playing this hand, given their dealt tiles

Throws:
PlayerWonException - thrown when a player wins, which is technically impossible pre-game, since no one will have enough tiles to do so yet

dealTiles

private int dealTiles()
Statistically there is no difference between "dealing sets of 4, times three, plus an additional 1 for each player, plus 1 for east" and "cyclically dealing 52 tiles and then starting the game by having player 1 draw a tile". Since the second is far less code, we're going with that approach.

Returns:
the first available tile in the wall (because the implementation draws first, then checks what to do with it...)

showPrePlayStats

private void showPrePlayStats()
log what each player "looks like" before we begin play

processDraw

private int processDraw(java.lang.String playertypename,
                        int tile,
                        int previousplayer,
                        int turn)
                 throws PlayerWonException,
                        UndoException
Draw the first available wall tile, making sure to catch the "I need another tile" exception that might arise from a concealed kong or bonus tile

Parameters:
playertypename - the shortstring for the current player's type and name
tile - the first available wall tile
previousplayer - the number of the previous player
turn - the current turn number
Returns:
the tile that was discarded in response to this draw (which might
Throws:
PlayerWonException - thrown when a player self-draw wins
UndoException

                              int from)
notify all players that a tile was played face-up

Parameters:
tile - the tile in question
from - the player who played it face-up

private void tilesPlayedFaceUp(int[] tiles,
                               int from)
notify all players that a set of tiles was played face-up

Parameters:
tiles - the set of tiles in question
from - the player who played them face-up

processDiscard

private int processDiscard(int discard,
                           int turn,
                           java.lang.String playertypename)
                    throws PlayerWonException,
                           UndoException,
                           IllegalOutException
process the discard during a turn - either people will want to claim it for something, or play moves to the next player in the hand.

Parameters:
discard - the discarded tile
turn - the turn the tile was discarded in
playertypename - the shortstring for the turn's player's type and name
Returns:
the updated turn number, changed due to someone claiming the discard - play must resume as if it had been their turn instead
Throws:
PlayerWonException - thrown when a player goes out on this discard
UndoException
IllegalOutException

resolveClaims

private int resolveClaims(int[] interested,
                          int turn,
                          int discard)
                   throws PlayerWonException,
                          UndoException
resolve the claim-bids made on a discarded tile by any or all other players

Parameters:
interested - the array with interest bids (numbered from the TilePattern static integers)
turn - the turn this discard-claim is processed in
discard - the tile that was discarded and may be claimed
Returns:
the updated turn number, changed due to someone claiming the discard - play must resume as if it had been their turn instead
Throws:
PlayerWonException - thrown when a player goes out on this discard
UndoException

cacheEverything

private void cacheEverything(int turn)
inform the wall and players to cache their tile configuration

private int undo(int number)
inform all players an undo was called and returns the previous turn number
